title: How to Bake Oysters

steps.headline: Rinse and shuck 3 dozen oysters.
steps.description: Wear gloves to protect your hands and use a small brush to scrub the shells. Rinse them to remove dirt and grit. Then use an oyster knife to open each shell. Set them aside.Discard any oysters that are already open before shucking.

steps.headline: Sauté 1 medium onion for 7 to 8 minutes.
steps.description: Put 1/2 cup (113 g) of cubed butter into a large skillet and turn the burner to medium. Once the butter melts, stir in the finely chopped onion. Stir and cook the onion until it's soft and translucent.

steps.headline: Stir in the fresh spinach and cook it for 1 to 2 minutes.
steps.description: Tear 1 1/4 cups (280 g) of fresh spinach into rough pieces and stir it into the sautéed onion. Continue to cook the mixture over medium heat until the spinach wilts. Then turn off the burner.

steps.headline: Stir in the Romano cheese, lemon juice, and pepper.
steps.description: Add 1 cup (100 g) of grated Romano cheese to the skillet along with 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lemon juice and 1/8 teaspoon (0.25 g) of pepper. Stir the mixture until it's combined.If you don't have Romano cheese, you can use grated Parmesan.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 450 °F (232 °C) and spread the salt between 2 pans.
steps.description: Get out 2 ungreased 10x 1 in (25x38 cm) baking pans. Put 1 pound (450 g) of kosher or rock salt into each pan and spread the salt so it's level.

steps.headline: Arrange the oysters on the salt and fill them with the spinach mixture.
steps.description: Put about 18 of the oysters in their shells on the salt in 1 of the pans. Press the rest of the oysters in the other pan. Top each of the oysters with 2 1/2 teaspoons (13 g) of the spinach mixture.The salt will hold the oysters steady as they bake.

steps.headline: Bake the oysters for 6 to 8 minutes.
steps.description: Put both baking sheets in the oven and cook the oysters until they're plump and juicy.If you can't fit both pans in the oven at the same time, you'll need to cook the oysters in batches.

steps.headline: Remove and serve the oysters Rockefeller.
steps.description: Turn off the oven and take the baking pans out of the oven. You can serve the oysters directly from the pans or transfer them to serving plates.Avoid storing leftover oysters Rockefeller.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 450 °F (232 °C) and pulse the bread into crumbs.
steps.description: Tear 1 1/2 slices of white bread into a few large piece so they fit into a food processor. Put the lid on the food processor and pulse the bread about 10 times.You should get coarse breadcrumbs that measure about 3/4 cup (340 g).

steps.headline: Sauté the green onions, parsley, and garlic for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Spray a nonstick skillet with cooking spray and turn the burner to medium. Add 1/3 cup (50 g) of sliced green onions, 1/4 cup (5 g) of chopped fresh parsley, and 2 minced garlic cloves to the skillet. Cook and stir the mixture constantly until it softens. Then turn off the burner.

steps.headline: Stir in the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, lemon juice, and pepper.
steps.description: Add the fresh breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup (25 g) of Italian-seasoned breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup (25 g) of grated Parmesan cheese, 1 teaspoon (4.9 ml) of fresh lemon juice, 1/8 teaspoon (0.25 g) of ground red pepper, and 1/8 teaspoon (0.25 g) of black pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine the seasonings.

steps.headline: Arrange 24 oysters on a jelly roll pan.
steps.description: If you need to, scrub and shuck 2 dozen oysters. Then put the oysters on the half shell on a jelly roll pan in a single layer. Consider spreading rock or kosher salt on the jelly roll pan before you set the oysters on it. The salt will prevent the oysters from sliding around.

steps.headline: Cover the oysters with the breadcrumb mix and bake them for 7 minutes.
steps.description: Use a spoon to sprinkle the seasoned breadcrumb mixture evenly over the oysters in the jellyroll pan. Then put the pan in the oven and cook the oysters until the edges of the oysters curl up a little.

steps.headline: Remove and serve the Italian herb oysters.
steps.description: Turn off the oven and serve the oysters directly from the jellyroll pan. Offer your guests fresh lemon wedges to squeeze over the oysters. Avoid storing the leftover oysters.

methods.name: Cooking Oysters with Bacon and Leeks

steps.headline: Stir and cook butter with flour for 2 minutes to make a roux.
steps.description: Melt 1 tablespoon (14 g) of butter in a small pan over medium heat. Whisk in 1 tablespoon (8 g) of flour.Continue to whisk and cook until the mixture cooks into a thick paste.

steps.headline: Whisk the cream into the roux.
steps.description: Slowly pour 1 cup (240 ml) of whipping or heavy cream into the skillet and whisk constantly. Keep whisking for 1 to 2 minutes so the roux dissolves and the sauce thickens a little.Turn off the burner and set the sauce aside.

steps.headline: Fry the bacon for 6 to 8 minutes or until it's crispy.
steps.description: Chop ⁄2 pound (230 g) of bacon and put it into a large skillet. Turn the burner to medium and stir the bacon occasionally as it cooks. Drain away most of the grease in the pan, leaving about 2 tablespoons (30 ml) in the skillet.Place the crisp bacon on a paper-towel lined plate and set it aside while you prepare the oysters.

steps.headline: Sauté the leeks, celery, bay leaf, and cayenne for 10 to 12 minutes.
steps.description: Heat the skillet with the bacon fat over medium heat. Stir in 4 thinly sliced leeks, 1 cup (225 g) of finely chopped celery, 1 bay leaf, and 1/8 teaspoon (0.25 g) of cayenne pepper. Cook and cook the vegetables frequently until they soften.

steps.headline: Pour in the white wine and cook the sauce for 3 minutes.
steps.description: Slowly whisk in 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of dry white wine and continue to whisk until the sauce begins to simmer and thicken a little.

steps.headline: Stir in the bacon and cheese.
steps.description: Add the crispy bacon to the sauce and stir in 2 tablespoons (10 g) of grated Pecorino Romano cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste and turn off the burner. If you want to make the sauce ahead of time, cover and refrigerate it for up to 1 day.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 500 °F (260 °C) and put the oysters on a sheet.
steps.description: Take 20 shucked oysters and place the half shells on a rimmed baking sheet so the oysters are facing up. If you'd rather make oysters without their shells, divide them between 10 ramekins.

steps.headline: Top the oysters with the leek mixture and breadcrumbs.
steps.description: Spoon 2 tablespoons (15 g) of the leek sauce on each oyster. Sprinkle 1 cup (50 g) of fresh breadcrumbs evenly across the tops of the oysters. You can prepare the oysters 4 hours before cooking them. Refrigerate them until you're ready to bake them.

steps.headline: Bake the oysters for 8 minutes and serve them.
steps.description: Put the baking sheet in the oven and cook the bacon-leek oysters until the breadcrumbs are crispy and the leek sauce bubbles. Remove the oysters and serve them immediately. Don't store the leftover oysters because they won't keep well.
